H0.text: In Greek Myth which legendary monster fathered both the Chimera and Cerberus. Orthrus

H1.text: In Greek Myth which legendary monster fathered both the Chimera and Cerberus. Poseidon

H2.text: In Greek Myth which legendary monster fathered both the Chimera and Cerberus. Hydra

H3.text: In Greek Myth which legendary monster fathered both the Chimera and Cerberus. Τυφώς

A4.text: According to Hesiod's Theogony, Typhon was joined in love to Echidna, who bore Typhon 'fierce offspring', including Cerberus, the multiheaded dog who guarded the gates of Hades, and the Chimera (a fire-breathing beast that was part lion, part goat, and had a snake-headed tail) with Typhon then being the father.

A5.text: Hyginus (1st century BC), in his list of offspring of Typhon (all by Echidna), retains from the above: Cerberus, the Chimera, the Sphinx, the Hydra and Ladon.
